author: Andrew Beaton
title: How Buffalo and Marshall Took the Fast Track to NCAA Tournament Upsets
text:
Princeton beating UCLA in 1996 and nearly beating Georgetown in 1989 were classic NCAA tournament games that provided a strategy for every underdog that would come after Pete Carril’s team: play slow.
That’s what makes the two biggest upsets of this year’s NCAA tournament—No. 13 seed Buffalo over No. 4 seed Arizona on Thursday night and No. 13 seed Marshall over No. 4 seed Wichita State on Friday afternoon—even more improbable than they might seem. Buffalo and Marshall play exactly how underdogs shouldn’t: really, really... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
